meanings.definition: To carefully examine or check the qualifications or background of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I will vetter the new employees to ensure they meet our standards.
meanings.sent2: The detective will vetter the evidence before presenting it in court.
meanings.sent3: He decided to vetter the ingredients of the mysterious potion before drinking it.
meanings.sent4: She always vettered the information like a detective solving a case.
meanings.sent5: The scientist vettered the data meticulously to avoid any errors.

meanings.definition: A person who examines or checks the qualifications or background of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The vetter carefully reviewed the candidate's resume.
meanings.sent2: The vetter's job is crucial in ensuring the company hires the right people.
meanings.sent3: The vetter's magnifying glass was his favorite tool for inspections.
meanings.sent4: She was like a vetter, always looking for the truth behind every story.
meanings.sent5: The vetter's keen eye caught even the smallest discrepancies in the documents.
